clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Clinical Frailty Scale and Modified Frailty Index in Intensive Care Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Clinical Frailty Scale and Modified Frailty Index in Intensive Care Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of our study is to evaluate the correlation of the Clinical Frailty Scale, which is a judgment-based measure, and the Modified Frailty Index, which interrogates the patient's current diseases, in the frailty assessment of intensive care patients and the effect on the estimation of mortality, mechanical ventilation need, intensive care stay, hospital stay and discharge status.

primary_outcome.time_frame: in the first 24 hours of intensive care admissions
primary_outcome.description: the correlation of the Clinical Frailty Scale, which is a judgment-based measure, and the Modified Frailty Index, which interrogates the patient's current diseases, in the frailty assessment of intensive care patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the patient will be monitored for 1 year and the exitus time will be recorded
secondary_outcome.description: effect of the clinical frailty scale and modified farilty index on the estimation of mortality

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the patient will be monitored for 1 year and the intensive care stay will be recorded
secondary_outcome.description: effect of the clinical frailty scale and modified farilty index on the estimation of intensive care stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the patient will be monitored for 1 year and the discharge status will be recorded
secondary_outcome.description: effect of the clinical frailty scale and modified farilty index on the estimation of discharge status

intervention.description: Clinical fragility scale will be recorded in the first 24 hours of intensive care admissions.
Modified Frailty Index will be recorded in the first 24 hours of intensive care admissions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- intensive care patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with a life expectancy of less than 24 hours
- Do not speak Turkish
